snippet: The prolonged death of Clayton D. Lockett in Oklahoma produced more than the usual horror in Europe, with Britain and France condemning the execution and calling for the abolition of the death penalty.
abstract: Members of European Union condemn execution death of Clayton D Lockett in Oklahoma, brutal ordeal that dragged on for 43 minutes; authorities used improvised cocktail of drugs to kill Lockett due to shortages of sodium thiopental, drug commonly used for lethal injections, resulting in badly enacted execution.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Stephen Castle and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London, Maïa de la Baume from Paris, Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, and Heather Murphy from New York.

lead_paragraph: The prolonged death of Clayton D. Lockett in Oklahoma produced more than the usual horror in Europe, with Britain and France condemning the execution and calling for the abolition of the death penalty.

headline.main: Outrage Across Ideological Spectrum in Europe Over Flawed Lethal Injection in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Outrage Across Ideological Spectrum in Europe Over Flawed Lethal Injection
